Hey man, awesome upload I think this is exactly what i need.  However, I'm having trouble trying to figure out wether to get the x86 or the x64 one.  I have an Athlon AMD64 X2 processor.  Does that mean I need the 64 version?  Also, the reason i need this is because I messed my computer up bad and I think I deleted windows altogether, will this help me?

you can use either, 64 is best but if you have some older hardware and usb plugin things then you might not get drivers for them all, stuff made in the last 2 years you will, 64 needs a bit more memory to run, 2gb but can handle as much memory as you want, check your pc website to see what drivers they provide, any problems just use 32 x86.

I am currently running on a 32 bit Vista Home Premium.How do I know whether my computer is capable of 64bit?

Okay now that I know my system can run 64-bit Vista, I have a doubt. When i bought my laptop I got some softwares pre-installed. It says that after I upgrade my system I have to install my programs again. So would I have to install those pre-installed softwares again
Please I need a reply because if I upgrade my system and those programs (including Recovery Solution IV, PC Troubleshoot, Easy Network Manager etc.) are deleted then I am screwed

yes you wont get the oem programes on this disc,, but you can usually download them seperatly from the manufacturers website,, the recovery is not an issue, the vista dvd has the repair/restore media in it and vista has backup and restore, whatever you got with the pc will be on the bay anyways,,, go for it,, did you know you can dual boot 32 & 64 bit systems?

Whatcha mean by dual boot?
Anyways do you know how I can upgrade from Vista Home Premium 32-bit to Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit?Any torrent or anything?

Sah13, dual boot means you have 32 and 64 bit installed, when you turn on your pc you get a choice of what one to use, google easybcd.

you can only upgrade 32 to 32 and 64 to 64

Kool, but I'd rather have vista and win7 dual booted!

you dont go back to xp, its old and crap, you upgrade to windows 7 now as your pc runs vista it will run 7;
